sentences: Miles Parks McCollum (born August 23, 1997), known professionally as Lil Yachty, is an American rapper from Atlanta, Georgia.

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Miles McCollum was born in Mableton, Georgia.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He attended Alabama State University in fall 2015 but soon dropped out to pursue his musical career.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He adopted the name "Yachty" and moved from his hometown of Atlanta to New York City to launch his career.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In New York, he lived with a friend and networked with online street fashion personalities, while he built up his own Instagram following.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He worked at McDonald's to supplement his income early in his career.
section: == Early life ==

section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: Yachty first came to prominence in December 2015 when the SoundCloud version of his song "One Night" was used in a viral comedy video.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: In February 2016, Yachty debuted as a model in Kanye West's Yeezy Season 3 fashion line at Madison Square Garden.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: Yachty's debut mixtape Lil Boat was released in March 2016.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: In April 2016, Yachty collaborated with DRAM on the hit song "Broccoli", which peaked at number 5 on the Billboard Hot 100.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: He featured on Chance the Rapper's Coloring Book mixtape, released in May 2016.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: On June 10, 2016 he announced he had signed a joint venture record deal with Quality Control Music, Capitol Records, and Motown Records.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: Yachty released his second mixtape Summer Songs 2 in July 2016.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: In June 2016, Lil Yachty appeared in XXL magazine as part of their 2016 Freshman Class.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: As part of this appearance, Yachty performed a ‘freshman cypher’ alongside Denzel Curry, Lil Uzi Vert, 21 Savage, and Kodak Black.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: As of March 2021, this cypher has received over 180 million YouTube views, by far the most for the XXL channel.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: In December 2016, he was featured on the hip hop single "iSpy" by Kyle.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: He was featured in Tee Grizzley's single "From the D to the A", released in March 2017.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: On May 26, 2017, Lil Yachty released his debut studio album, Teenage Emotions.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: It features guest appearances from Migos, Diplo, and YG, among others.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: Three promotional singles were released to coincide with the album.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: The first promotional single, "Harley", produced by K Swisha, was released on April 14, 2017.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: The second promotional single, "Bring It Back", produced by Free School, was released on May 4, 2017.
section: == Career == | === 2015–2017: "One Night", Lil Boat, and Teenage Emotions ===

sentences: The third promotional single, "X Men", produced by 30 Roc and Tillie and featuring a guest appearance from American rapper Evander Griiim, was released on May 18, 2017.

sentences: In January 2018, it was reported that Lil Yachty and Takeoff were working on a collaborative project.

sentences: This project has yet to be released as of 2021.

sentences: Yachty's second studio album, Lil Boat 2, was released on March 9, 2018.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: Despite receiving mixed reviews from critics, Lil Boat 2 performed well commercially, debuting at number two on the US Billboard 200, with 64,000 album-equivalent units.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: The album featured 2 Chainz, Quavo, and Offset, among other guests.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: On October 19, 2018, Yachty released his third album, Nuthin' 2 Prove.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: The project received similarly mixed reception and debuted at No. 12 on the Billboard 200.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: Also in 2018, Yachty appeared on Social House's gold single "Magic in the Hamptons" and Bhad Bhabie's platinum single "Gucci Flip Flops", and worked with Donny Osmond to create a theme song for Chef Boyardee titled "Start the Par-dee".
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: In December 2018, E-sports group FaZe Clan announced that Yachty had become their newest member.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: Yachty took on the name "FaZe Boat", in reference to his 'Lil Boat' nickname and mixtape.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: After a relatively quiet 2019, Lil Yachty teamed up with fellow Atlanta artists Lil Keed, Lil Gotit, and veteran producer Zaytoven in February 2020 for a collaborative mixtape, A-Team.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: Yachty released the lead single for his next studio album, Lil Boat 3, on March 9, 2020.
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

sentences: The song, titled "Oprah's Bank Account", features Drake and DaBaby..
section: == Career == | === 2018–present: Lil Boat 2, Nuthin' 2 Prove and Lil Boat 3 ===

== Musical style ==

sentences: Musical style ==
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: Lil Yachty has called his style "bubblegum trap."
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: His songs have sampled sounds from Mario Bros., Charlie Brown, the theme from Rugrats, the startup sound of a GameCube console, as well as J-pop singer Daoko.
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: Other themes in his works include clouds, cotton candy, the Super Nintendo, and scenes from Pixar films.
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: His friend TheGoodPerry is heavily involved in the production of his songs.
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: Yachty's style has also been described as mumble rap.
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: Rolling Stone described his music as "catchy, intentionally dinky-sounding tunes packed with off-color boasts delivered in a proudly amateurish singsong."
section: == Musical style ==

sentences: The Guardian called his music "fun, hook-first pop rap oblivious to songcraft and structure that doesn't take itself too seriously, with very little interest in legacy and even less in rap canon."
section: == Musical style ==
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On September 1, 2015, Yachty and one other man were arrested at a mall in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida for credit card fraud, Yachty was released after posting a bail bond of $11,000.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: According to Yachty, his records were expunged.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In a 2016 interview for CNN, Yachty expressed support for Bernie Sanders in the 2016 presidential election, and praised Sanders for his work during the civil rights movement.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On October 20, 2021 Yachty announced the birth of his first child, a girl.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: At this time the mother is unknown.
